original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade on pipe line discussions
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edged up in mid day trade on Friday, as news on the Indian Oil Corporation has made proposals for an Oil distribution pipeline connecting from Nagapattinam in India to Sri Lanka, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was up 0.31 percent or 32.96 points to 10,542.48, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.80 percent or 24.59 points to 3,082.91

“A proposal by Indian Oil Corporation(IOC) for an Oil distribution pipeline connecting Nagapattinam, Trincomalee & Colombo was discussed,” Kanchana Wijesekera, Minister of Power and Energy tweeted on Thursday (13).

“I requested them to look at a two way oil & gas pipeline taking in to consideration the Governments development plan for Trinco tank farm & energy hub, future developments of refineries, oil & gas exploration, pipeline connections to domestic LPG terminals that will target regional oil and gas export markets while enabling energy requirements of both countries,” Wijesekera tweeted.
The Energy Industry Group brought in a revenue of 216 million rupees during mid day trade, while the market generated a turnover of 1.2 billion rupees.
Top gainers during mid day trade were Lanka IOC, Expolanka and Commercial Bank. (Colombo/Jul14/2023)
